title: Anthropic Reaches Settlement in Landmark AI Copyright Case
description: Artificial intelligence firm Anthropic has settled a class action lawsuit with U.S. authors accusing it of copyright infringement for AI training. The case, the first of its kind, saw Anthropic potentially liable for billions over allegedly using pirated books without permission. Settlement details are forthcoming.
content: Anthropic, an AI company, announced on Tuesday it has resolved a class action lawsuit involving U.S. authors who alleged the company infringed on their copyrights for AI training purposes. This marks the first settlement among several high-profile AI... [636 chars]

title: Google’s Gemini AI Gets Major Image Editing Update: Nano Banana
description: Google has improved the image editing features of the Gemini artificial intelligence-powered chatbot via a major update. Read more...

title: AI technology develops rapidly as experts debate benefits and risks
description: Tech executives express mixed views on the future impact of artificial intelligence, with concerns about job displacement balanced against potential benefits for society.
content:
Artificial intelligence is developing rapidly. While some are embracing it, others are warning of the potential threats. But both sides agree, the technology is changing how the world operates.

title: OpenAI, Altman sued over ChatGPT's role in California teen's suicide
description: The parents of a teen who died by suicide after ChatGPT coached him on methods of self harm sued OpenAI and CEO Sam Altman on Tuesday, saying the company knowingly put profit above safety when it launched the GPT-4o version of its artificial intelligence chatbot last year.

title: Musk's xAI sues Apple and OpenAI for alleged AI conspiracy lawsuit
description: Elon Musk's xAI sued Apple and OpenAI in federal court, alleging the companies conspired to prevent competition in the market for artificial intelligence tools.
content:
Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence startup xAI sued Apple and ChatGPT maker OpenAI in U.S. federal court in Texas on Monday, accusing them of illegally conspiring to thwart competition for artificial intelligence.
